page.title: 07Belford Hall.
page.content: Belford Hall is a grade 2* listed building. It was built in 1756 by James Payne for a Newcastle merchant named Abraham Dixon.It is built in the classical style (Palladian) from local yellow sandstone.It ceased to be a family home in the 1930's and was used as billeting accomodation for troops during World War 2, after which it was neglected and allowed to decay.The Hall was bought by quarry owners McLaren of Belford, and in 1983 acquired by English Heritage for restoration and alteration to the interior to provide 17 houses and flats.The rolling pasture fronting the Hall is being retained in its original setting with aged hardwood trees being replaced.
